summary: Assistive technology—e.g., modified scissors or apps that read computer screens aloud—can help students with disabilities participate at school. However, staff in the 8 school districts we visited said they face challenges providing it. For example, staff may not be aware of the range of available technology or be trained to use it. Staff in the districts told us about strategies that helped address these challenges...
title: Students With Disabilities: Assistive Technology Challenges and Resources in Selected School Districts and Schools
